Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Very Reverend Father George Anastasiou who serves as the spiritual leader of the Holy Cross Greek Orthodox Church of Whitestone, located at 11-05 150th Street, Whitestone, New York 11357.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vallone.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Very Reverend Father George Anastasiou, spiritual leader of the Holy Cross Greek Orthodox Church of Whitestone, located at 11-05 150th Street, Whitestone, New York 11357.

Council Member Vallone moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of emergency management to report on the city’s preparedness and response to citywide public health emergencies
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of emergency management to report on the city’s preparedness and response to citywide public health emergencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to temporary space for outdoor non-tobacco hookah operation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Temporary space for outdoor non-tobacco hookah operation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.7628A/A.9657, an act to amend the public housing law, in relation to establishing the housing access voucher program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Establishing the housing access voucher program. (S.7628A/A.9657)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring an exit interview for departing and retiring municipal employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Requiring an exit interview for departing and retiring municipal employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to climate resiliency design guidelines and resiliency scoring
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Climate resiliency design guidelines and resiliency scoring.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to studying the feasibility of electrifying existing buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Studying the feasibility of electrifying existing buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass and the President to sign the Energy Innovation and Carbon Dividend Act of 2019 (H.R. 763).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Energy Innovation and Carbon Dividend Act of 2019 (H.R. 763)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on mental health support services for employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police dept to report on mental health support services for employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to continuation of the New York city rent stabilization law of nineteen hundred sixty-nine
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Continuation of the NYC rent stabilization law of 1969.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to introduce and pass legislation to establish a National Bank for Infrastructure and Manufacturing, to help finance the estimated $4.6 trillion required to modernize and repair infrastructure in the United States.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Establish a National Bank for Infrastructure and Manufacturing.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.6775/S.1253, to designating the county of Kings a cease and desist zone and establishing an affirmative defense to violations of nonsolicitation orders and cease and desist zones.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Designating the county of Kings a cease and desist zone and establishing an affirmative defense to violations of nonsolicitation orders and cease and desist zones. (A.6775/S.1253)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation to establish indoor air quality standards and measure indoor air quality in New York City schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Establish indoor air quality standards and measure indoor air quality in NYC schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign legislation that reforms New York State’s notary laws for new and renewing notary applicants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Reforms New York State’s notary laws for new and renewing notary applicants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation adopting more stringent standards around corporations’ names that mimic government agencies to protect City residents from deed theft.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Adopting more stringent standards around corporations’ names that mimic government agencies to protect City residents from deed theft.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that increases the felony classification of crimes applicable to the prosecution of a fraudulent conveyance of residential real estate.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Increases the felony classification of crimes applicable to the prosecution of a fraudulent conveyance of residential real estate.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.1203/A.1911, an act to amend the general business law, in relation to biometric privacy.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Biometric Privacy (S.1203/A.1911)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports on enforcement of jaywalking
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to submit reports on enforcement of jaywalking.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President  to sign, S.2689, sponsored by Senator Cory Booker, which would prohibit the use of biometric recognition technology and biometric analytics in certain federally assisted rental dwelling units, and for other purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Prohibit the use of biometric recognition technology and biometric analytics in certain federally assisted rental dwelling units, and for other purposes. (S.2689)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York Police Department to create a permanent, year-round harbor patrol in the Bronx, and review its allocation plan for citywide harbor patrols, in order to address concerns in the City Island area.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYPD to create a permanent, year-round harbor patrol in the Bronx, and review its allocation plan for citywide harbor patrols, in order to address concerns in the City Island area.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to accessibility in small businesses
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Accessibility in small businesses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the department of consumer and worker protection to issue temporary operating licenses to sidewalk cafe applicants if certain requirements are satisfied
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the department of consumer and worker protection to issue temporary operating licenses to sidewalk cafe applicants if certain requirements are satisfied.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to reporting on moneys on deposit
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Reporting on moneys on deposit.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reporting on non-depository city financial services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Reporting on non-depository city financial services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 5337, the Disaster Assistance Equity Act, which would amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to provide assistance for common interest communities, condominiums and housing cooperatives damaged by a major storm.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disaster Assistance Equity Act (H.R. 5337)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain retail food stores to post notices on the food donation web portal concerning the availability of excess food, and arranging for the transportation and retrieval of such food
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain retail food stores to post notices on the food donation web portal concerning the availability of excess food, and arranging for the transportation and retrieval of such food.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing rental assistance to survivors of domestic violence
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Providing rental assistance to survivors of domestic violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring sheriffs and city marshals to report housing displacement to the department of social services/human resources administration to evaluate eligibility for legal counsel
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring sheriffs and city marshals to report housing displacement to the department of social services/human resources administration to evaluate eligibility for legal counsel.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of education to report on metrics regarding remote learning during the COVID-19 pandemic
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to report on metrics regarding remote learning during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this virtual Stated Meeting.

At the time of this virtual Stated Meeting, there was one vacant seat on the Council in the 37th District (Brooklyn) pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of a November 3, 2020 General Election.

Items.Title: Albany Crossings Apartments, Block 1858, Lot 24 (f.k.a. Lots 24, 25, 28, and 30), Block 1859, Lots 6, 10, 14, 15, and 16; Brooklyn, Community District No. 3, Council District 36.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Albany Crossings Apartments, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Kingston Heights Apartments, Block 1676, Lot 1, Block 1854, Lots 12, 14, 16, and 19, Block 1863, Lot 44, Block 1864, Lot 73, Block 1871, Lots 3 and 5; Brooklyn, Community District No. 3, Council District 36.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Kingston Heights Apartments, Brooklyn

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned the virtual meeting to meet again on Thursday, October 15, 2020.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 2032-A,  44-5-1 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Holden, Ulrich, Vallone, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo); Abstain: CM Miller.

Int. No. 2049-A,  45-4-1 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Holden, Ulrich, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo); Abstain: CM Miller.

Int. No. 2083-A,  45-5-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Deutsch, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
